name: make new sprite
content:
Creates a new sprite of the chosen costume at the given location.

## Video: How to Make a Sprite
(Opens YouTube in new tab)

[How To Make A Sprite](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbTJpx3driA)

This block customizes how the sprite looks and where it starts on the display. The costume drop down menu gives a variety of sprite costumes to choose from and also has the option to draw a costume. A location block can be attached at the end of the block to control where the sprite will appear on the display.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: Create a new sprite with a "pink bunny" costume at (100, 300).

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: Create a carrot in a random location whenever the bunny is clicked.

palette_params.name: location
palette_params.description: The location where the sprite appears on the display

palette_params.name: costume
palette_params.description: Each Sprite Lab project or level will include some default sprite costumes, but you can also choose from a larger costume library or draw your own using the built-in pixel editor.

short_description: Creates a new sprite of the chosen costume at the given location.
tips: - The default starting location of the sprite is 200, 200. Play around with different location blocks to customize where the sprite appears.
